title: Carved font used in old National Park Service signs
content:
Good day...I'm looking for suggestions for a font like that used in the old US National Park signs...kind of "carved" but legible. Perhaps something with an American Indian look would be an alternative.

Your expert suggestions are appreciated as always...thanks in advance.

David
author: dla_001

comments.content:
You mean [like this?](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230452/http:/www.wildnatureimages.com/images%202/050609-056..jpg) That sign was probably routed by hand, possibly using a letter template (i.e. there's probably not a digital version, unless somebody made a font based on the sign).

You might want to check out [Gotham Rounded,](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230452/http:/typography.com/catalog/gothamrounded/index.html) although you'd probably have to distress it yourself.

- Lex

Thanks, Lex...that's the NP sign, for sure...I'm hoping to find something like that, but digital, without the need to distress it...it's for a short-deadline project (not that anyone else has experienced that...)

Any further suggestions would be welcomed...

David
